security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown guidance for PR creation. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or file system access beyond reading the documentation itself.

content.user_title: Create pull requests following Sentry conventions
content.value_statement: Developers need clear guidance for creating well-structured pull requests that follow team conventions. This skill provides step-by-step instructions for creating PRs with proper descriptions, title formatting, and reviewer assignment following Sentry engineering practices.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes branch state and git status before creating PRs
Writes structured PR descriptions with motivation and context
Formats PR titles using conventional commit syntax
Adds reviewers to pull requests via GitHub CLI
References issues using Fixes and Refs syntax
Verifies changes are committed and rebased before submission
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be installed and authenticated
Only provides guidance documentation, does not execute git commands
Follows Sentry-specific conventions which may differ from other organizations
Does not create actual PRs directly, only guides the process

use_cases.title: Create feature PRs
use_cases.description: Prepare and submit feature pull requests with proper title format, description, and context for reviewers.

use_cases.title: Submit bug fix PRs
use_cases.description: Document bug fixes with clear problem statements, root causes, and resolution explanations.

use_cases.title: Review PR descriptions
use_cases.description: Ensure submitted PRs follow team conventions with complete information for effective code review.

prompt_templates.title: Create a new feature PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a pull request for my feature branch. Analyze the current git status and guide me through creating a PR with proper title format and description following Sentry conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Document bug fix
prompt_templates.scenario: Submitting a bug fix for review
prompt_templates.prompt: I fixed a bug in the user API endpoint. Help me create a PR description that explains the problem, root cause, and solution clearly for reviewers.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor with context
prompt_templates.prompt: I refactored some validation logic into a shared module. Help me write a PR description that explains the motivation and why this refactor is needed.

prompt_templates.title: Add reviewers to PR
prompt_templates.prompt: I already created a PR but need to add reviewers. Help me use the GitHub CLI to add the appropriate team members for review.

best_practices: Keep PRs small and focused on a single feature or fix for faster reviews
Explain the 'why' behind changes, not just the 'what' - reviewers need to understand motivation
Request review early using draft PRs when you want feedback before completion
anti_patterns: Bundling unrelated changes into a single PR makes review difficult and increases risk
Including only diff summaries without context leaves reviewers guessing about motivation
Skipping issue references makes it harder to track the relationship between code and business value

faq.question: Does this skill work with GitLab or Bitbucket?
faq.answer: No, this skill is designed specifically for GitHub using the GitHub CLI (gh). Other platforms use different conventions and commands.

faq.question: What if I do not have GitHub CLI installed?
faq.answer: You can still use the guidance manually. The descriptions and title formats apply regardless of how you create the PR.

faq.question: Can I use this for private repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, the conventions apply to both public and private repositories. Ensure gh is authenticated for your private repo.

faq.question: Is my code and commit data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, this is a read-only guidance skill. It only reads your git status locally to provide context-aware advice.

faq.question: Why are Sentry conventions different from my team?
faq.answer: Sentry has specific engineering practices. You can adapt the title format and description structure to match your own team conventions.

faq.question: How is this different from Claude Code's built-in PR creation?
faq.answer: This skill provides Sentry-specific conventions and step-by-step guidance. The built-in commands may not follow these specific practices.
